intro: Boechera tiehmii, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This perennial herb typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in early spring, adding a delicate touch to mountainous landscapes. The plant's hairy stems and leaves help it retain moisture in arid conditions.
